name: Yangshuo Village Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a chance to get away to Yangshuo for the weekend and thanks to the Village Retreat we really made the most of it. The hotel is very well organized and makes it very easy to book tours that allow you to be independent of larger travel groups. The service in this regard is excellent. We booked this hotel on a Wed night and by Thu morning had already made arrangements to be picked up from the Guilin airport through the hotel and offered advice on taking a bamboo raft on the Li River. This whole pickup process went very smoothly. Once at the hotel, the mini-guide book that they provided in the room introduced us to an entire spectrum of activities that we had never even considered. Taking advantage of this information, we booked a tour through the hotel to the Dazai rice terraces. After an interesting drive through through the mountains, we hiked around Dazai and headed back to Guilin with enough time to catch our evening flight. The hotel recommended Dazai instead of Pingan because it was less touristy. While I can't compare because we didn't see Pingan, Dazai was pretty quiet and it seemed like we mostly had the place to ourselves.
reviews.title: Took my trip from good to great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed quite busy but the hotel itself is very nice and reminds me of the kind of place you might stay if you visit a mountain village in Italy or Switzerland. The room was big and comfortable and the food options on site were good. We ate breakfast there both days and had dinner there one night. The chinese food was well prepared but the western-style apple crumble was also great. In all, it would be a great place to relax and take it slow but the service and tour options were too tantalizing to let us sit still for long. I'm looking forward to returning to the area and this hotel.
reviews.title: A friendly place in a quiet location at excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Yangshuo Village Retreat for four nights in May 2012 and of all the hotels we got to see during our three-week trip through China, this one offered by far the best experience.
reviews.title: Friendly, peaceful and excellent value for money

reviews.text: YVR offers a pick-up service at Guilin Airport which is extremely handy if you're arriving there late in the evening (and in pouring rain, as we did). Since bus transfers can sometimes be a bit difficult to figure out and take a lot of time, I'd recommend to everyone to take advantage of this offer.
reviews.title: Friendly, peaceful retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet village and it takes about 20 minutes to walk to the center of Yangshuo. Staying here thus ensures a peaceful atmosphere while still allowing easy access to the amenities of Yangshuo.
reviews.title: Love, love, love this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yangshuo Village Retreat is a good place to stay. It is a little of the beaten path but still within walking distance through woods and along the river to the center of Yangshou. The stuff is very friendly and some speak good English. They are very willing to attend to your needs and make you feel welcome. The toilets are a little sluggish, but that is a very common occurance in China. Sound does travel through the walls quite a bit. But since most people were on the quite side it was not to big of a problem during our stay. There is roof terrace that everyone can enjoy and also outside seating with tables to eat or just relax.
reviews.title: nice place to stay

reviews.text: We have eaten there a few times and it was mostly a good experience.
reviews.title: Thinking of Yangshuo - go there

reviews.text: The owner has compiled a great tour guide for the area. You can rent bikes (with locks) right there and they will lend you a chinese straw hat, which is good thing when the sun is out. They also supply umbrellas for rainy days. All you need to do is ask for one. They do have flies that can be annoying, but even for that they supply you with Moskito Repellent.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff made our stay easy and didn't have to plan ahead!

reviews.text: All in all I can recommend Yangshuo Village Retreat for a stay and would stay there again if I happen to be in that area.
reviews.title: Great hotel and service, so-so room

reviews.text: We stayed in the chalet and found it to be very nice. It's a rustic experience, but it's clean, food is good and pretty western, the staff is friendly and very service minded. The staff organized all 3 days perfectly for us. Location is best in the area if you don't want to be in the middle of busy West Street. Highly recommended for especially families with kids.
reviews.title: You cannot ask for anything better
It was ok
reviews.text: Stayed here last December but didn't have time to right a review till now. Where should I begin? Hotel is located in a very quiet area therefore you definitely will get a good sleep versus the noisy West street. Bed as hard as rock but I guess you will get this everywhere in Yangshuo. Bathroom lay out very strange (your balcony is actually your bathroom). Room was very basic but clean. Staffs were very nice. We had breakfast and dinner in the restaurant and the food was not bad. It was an ok stay. If all you need is a decent place to take a shower and sleep then this is the place but don't expect something 5 stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought we were going to be miles away from the centre but were infact only a 15 minute walk away. I thought it was brilliant although my hubby thought it was a little strange. We had the honeymoon suite which had the biggest bed in the world and the bathroom had the biggest jacuzzi in the world. Information about tours etc was excellent. Food was very tasty and good value.
reviews.title: A real retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had to unfortunately cancel our trip to China but we had booked a stay at this hotel for a fews day. Needless to say, besides the obvious fact I was ticked we had to cancel our entire trip, I was quite sad to be missing out on the Honeymoon suite! So my comments are on the email communication I had leading up to our canceling.
reviews.title: Helpful and great communication

reviews.text: Overall I would rate the communication service as excellent. They were prompt in answering my questions, willing to schedule anything for me and when we had to cancel they were gracious and even refunded my deposit which they didn't have to since they were well within their rights of the cancellation policy. This isn't to say they'll do that every time but little things like that are appreciated especially since it was unexpected. Even before having to go through the cancelation I felt very at ease with my choice was looking forward to my stay. Genuine service and kindness in the hotel business is hard to come by nowadays and I felt like the owners have it in spades! One day I will make it to the Honeymoon Suite!!!
reviews.title: A brilliant week!

reviews.text: I have to start off by saying that my family and friends had a wonderful time here. I was in a party of 20 and I have to say, everyone had a great time, the service was brilliant and truthfully the only things I can say are positive. The hotel staff catered for everything, nothing was a problem; taxis, day trips, food, settling the bill; everything was simple, well organised and efficient. As we were a big group, Gerd the owner very conscious of this and was well organised prior to us arriving, so once we arrived, after a long bus journey, our room cards were ready and everyone could go and relax straight away.
reviews.title: Do not deserve the title of best hotel in Yangshuo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and only checked out yesterday. Originally me & my boyfriend were booked to stay for 2 nights but ended up booking an extra 4! The hotel is in a beautiful part of Yangshuo away from the busy town and only 5 minutes from the Li river. The staff are very helpful with things that you can do near the hotel, including swimming in the Li river, horse riding, cycling to a few towns (depending how far you want to cycle) and Tai chi. When we were there bikes were 30CNY each for the day, horse riding was 120 CNY each for an hour and tai chi was 70CNY each for an hour (all very good prices compared to every where else!!) I think we really noticed how nice and peaceful the hotel was once we took a walk into town (about 20 minutes) and wanted to head straight back to Yangshuo village retreat. The rooms are beautifully decorated, with SOFT beds (rare in China...) and a lovely bathroom with rain shower. There is a flat screen tv in the rooms and you can hire a USB with as many films that will fit onto it for just 20CNY for one night. Unfortunately, it rained a few days we were in Yangshuo so the USB was a great escape! Not only is the setting beautiful, but the staff are also very friendly and helpful. The owner is available at all times and spoke to us on many occasions, not to mention the others - in paticular Jenny, Paul, Freya, Helen and Sunny (if I could remember more names there would be a huge list!) Nothing we asked was too much hassle, and Helen at reception organised for us to travel to Vietnam directly from the hotel. I am writing this now from Hanoi and I couldn't have asked for a better and more organised trip so thank you very much!! Helen also took us on the bamboo rafts (on her day off - not on a tour) which is well worth seeing, and was also very enjoyable as it was on a more casual basis rather than work related. The food is lovely at the hotel. We ate there every night eating both Western and Chinese dishes and all were really nice as well as being a very good price (food in town is the same price, if not more so for a secluded location we were very impressed!). As mentioned before, we only left yesterday and we would return immediately if we did not have such a tight schedule! We miss it a lot!! :( what else can I say apart from it is definitely a 5 star service and I would recommend it to anyone!!
reviews.title: Briliant!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is the best stay ive had in all of china. The rooms were spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was nicely done and the rain shower was great. The food was reasonably priced and always very good. The staff are excellent from the owner to the restaurant staff to the reception. They took the time to learn your names and were always happy. You was always greeted with a smile. The location is great,very peacful and the town is only a short walk away. They can advise you on great things to do.Helen on reception sorted onwards travel to hanoi with a nights stay in nanning for a very good price. Trip the owner is a pleasure to talk to. I highly recommend this hotel if staying in yangshou,if returning i wouldnt stay anywhere else but here and it was a shame to leave this great place and the great people.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel...Perfect staff

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the penthouse suite for 4 nights.it is a very large 2 bedroom apartment with a large master suite, a very large living room and a second bedroom with a king bed and 2 bathrooms. They rent excellent bikes and have a wonderful restaurant that is open all day. They arrange guides if required to see the countryside. There is wifi coverage throughout the hotel. When we arrived our wifi in the suite was not working. As soon as the owner, Gerd, was informed of this - he had the router rewired and it was working the same day.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel run hands on by owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May can be wet in Yangshuo. And sure enough it was pouring when we arrived and it rained most of the time we were in residence. The river was flooding, and generally everything was pretty soggy. Enough to "dampen" our short holiday? Not a bit. Not at Yangshuo Village Retreat at least. Gerd and his wonderful staff can't do enough to help, and everything around the hotel is clean, efficient, and just works well. Guest rooms are large and the bed and pillows can't be faulted. An in house restaurant is very convenient, serves a wide range of both Chinese and international food at very reasonable prices. Gerd even has some of his precious Belgian beer available ... If you are good! Bikes and motor scooters are available for hire to explore the many regional attractions. The Retreat is a short quiet walk through the countryside or along the river to the bustling Yangshuo tourist trap. We were very pleased that we selected the serenity of the Retreat rather than the continual hustle, bustle and noise of the town. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Gungho for Yangshuo

reviews.text: Staff goes out of their way to help. They will book tour tickets at ok prices, eliminating touts and uncertainty. They really want to see you happy.
reviews.title: Quiet Secluded Hotel in Yangshuo.

description: Welcome to the Yangshuo Village Retreat, an established 4-star Belgian-Chinese family retreat in the beautiful and peaceful countryside near Yangshuo, Guilin, China. We provide a free shuttle service to town all day per comfortable mini-van that takes you to the heart of Yangshuo in 5 minutes. For longer stays we offer every 7th night free of charge! Located in a quiet village, nestled in between mountains, rice paddies and citrus trees, our Yangshuo hotel offers the perfect base to explore the countryside, its rural features and amazing scenery, and provides the ideal environment to sit back, relax, and enjoy the idyllic landscape Yangshuo is famous for, with the comforts of home. And with only a beautiful walk along the Li-river bank to Yangshuo’s main shopping and entertainment area, the Yangshuo Village Retreat might have the best location of all Yangshuo hotels…
